intro: Spinacia oleracea subsp. glabra, commonly known as smooth spinach, is a cultivated variant of the common spinach plant. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves, which distinguish it from other subspecies. This subspecies is typically grown for its edible leaves, which are rich in nutrients such as vitamins A and C. The plant thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for both home gardens and commercial agriculture.
